subjectDescription: Discover a full suite of online business courses that will allow you to make better business decisions and succeed in today's competitive business world. Our courses provide a rich learning experience that will allow you to develop critical business skills in areas such as business... Read more...
title: Maximizing Customer Engagement for Business Growth
headline: This free online course explains how to boost customer engagement and loyalty with these proven marketing strategies.
description: Customers who interact with a brand form solid and long-lasting relationships with it. This marketing and branding course lays out the benefits of researching and understanding your target audience before creating products to meet their needs. We also show you how to calculate the customer lifetime value of a business, foster engagement with your audience and effectively manage failures that may affect customer service and thus your brand.

Highlight  the ‘audience first’ approach to business
Outline the benefits of identifying your target audience
Discuss how to calculate the customer lifetime value of a business
Explain the importance of the customer lifetime value metric
Identify strategies that can generate positive word-of-mouth referrals
Recognize the benefits of appreciating and retaining loyal customers
courseDescription:
‘Customer engagement’ is the continuous relationship between a business and a customer that extends beyond a single purchase. Customer experience is thus what drives both engagement and satisfaction - and eventually customer conversions. Your customer engagement strategy should therefore focus on creating positive consumer experiences to continuously encourage people to do business with you. This course provides effective customer engagement strategies based on marketing and branding principles to foster business growth.

The first section explains the ‘audience first’ approach and highlights its benefits. We then explain how to calculate the customer lifetime value of a business. We demonstrate how understanding and optimizing the customers' lifetime value drives a business’ growth and long-term profitability. We also pinpoint approaches designed to generate positive word-of-mouth referrals by your customers.

The course’s next section discusses how you can use humor in marketing campaigns as a great way to connect with your audience and let your business stand apart from competitors. Finally, we examine the benefits of appreciating and retaining loyal customers and explain what to do in the event of a service mistake or failure committed by your company. This kind of customer service plays a key role in maintaining a strong brand image. Whether you are just starting a new business as an entrepreneur or managing an already existing one, you will find the marketing strategies covered in this course very useful. Sign up to learn how to build a brand and engage loyal customers through eye-catching marketing and excellent customer service.

Start Course Now
certificateDetail:
All Alison courses are free to enrol study and complete. To successfully complete this certificate course and become an Alison Graduate, you need to achieve 80% or higher in each course assessment. Once you have completed this certificate course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

Your Alison certificate is:
  • Ideal for sharing with potential employers
  • Include it in your CV, professional social media profiles and job applications.
  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.
  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital certificate: a downloadable certificate in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked certificate, posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security marked certificate in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.
Start Course Now

All certificate are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison certificate, please visit our FAQs. If you decide not to purchase your Alison certificate, you can still demonstrate your achievement by sharing your Learner Record or Learner Achievement Verification, both of which are accessible from your Dashboard. For more details on our certificate pricing, please visit our Pricing Page

modules.name: Module
modules.description: Customer loyalty and high conversion rates are the results of well-thought-out customer engagement strategies. This module provides practical suggestions on how to build an effective customer engagement strategy that creates strong relationships between customers and businesses.
topics: Building an Audience for Your Products
Use Humor to Engage Your Audience
How to Handle Mistakes in Business

modules.name: Module
topics: Maximizing Customer Engagement for Business Growth - Course Assessment

slides:
• Learning Outcomes

  • Having completed this module, you will be able to:
    • Discuss the "audience first" approach in business.
    • Outline the benefits of identifying your target audience.
    • Explain how to calculate the Customer Lifetime Value of a business.
    • State the importance of the Customer Lifetime Value metric.
    • Identify strategies that can generate positive word-of-mouth referrals.
    • Recognize the benefits of appreciating loyal customers.
    • Describe how to handle mistakes and failures in business.

  • Identifying and Solving Problems

  • Japheth and Allison are passionate about tennis and fashion, but they both feel that the clothing styles for tennis don’t sit well with them. They feel it could be much better. 

    As they discuss this problem after a match, they come up with a solution: starting their own line of trendy tennis apparel!

  • Select an Image from the Gallery

  • While they have lots of enthusiasm and know more than a little about style, they're not sure if there's a demand for more fashionable tennis clothing or if they have the business skills to make their idea a reality. Will they be able to turn their passion for tennis and fashion into a successful venture?
  • Answer the following questions to see how best these two can get a good start on making their business a success.

  • Understanding Customer Lifetime Value

  • It's no secret that customers are an essential part of any business, but not all customers are created equal.

    Consider a company called Ramics Vases, whose handcrafted flower vases are popular with a variety of customers, but they want to focus on attracting and retaining the most valuable ones. One way to do this is by using a metric called customer lifetime value (CLV).
  • CLV allows businesses to evaluate their entire relationship with a customer and estimate how much that person is worth to the business over the long term.

    This can help businesses make informed decisions about how much to spend to acquire and retain customers, as well as target their marketing efforts towards the most valuable segments of their customer base.

  • Select an Image from the Gallery

  • By understanding the CLV of their target buyers, Ramics Vases can make strategic decisions about how to grow their base of valuable customers and increase their long-term profitability.

  • The Power of Brand Advocacy

  • Generating word-of-mouth marketing for your business is an effective and affordable way to increase brand awareness and attract new customers. 
  • About 90% of customers globally trust recommendations about a product from friends and family more than anything else. This means that it is one of the best marketing strategies for any business to utilize. 

    One of the most effective ways to achieve this is by offering a high-quality product or service that exceeds customers' expectations and leaves a lasting impression.

  • Select an Image from the Gallery

  • For example, a startup that sells eco-friendly dental floss may wrap its product in environmentally-friendly packaging to align with its mission, while a diner may put extra care into the presentation of its food to make it more visually appealing to customers.

  • Use Humour to Connect with Your Audience

  • Using humor in marketing campaigns is a great way to connect with your audience and differentiate your business from competitors. By creating a character with an unusual trait or using situational humor, you can tell a memorable story that engages your target audience and sticks in their minds.
  • One example of this is Hotels.com's use of Captain Obvious in its ad campaign.

    Captain Obvious, a character with a quirky appearance and deadpan delivery, reinforced the connection between hotel bookings and Hotels.com in the minds of the target audience, resulting in a 30% increase in site traffic.

  • Select an Image from the Gallery

  • Incorporating humor into your marketing efforts can also be as simple as adding a funny element to social media content, blog posts, or other mediums. Establish a vivid scene and character, and maintain the internal logic of the story by following the rules of the game.

    It's important to keep in mind that humor is all about context, and you should make sure that the jokes you use are timely and relatable to your target audience, as well as appropriate for the medium you're using.

    Captain Obvious, a character with a quirky appearance and deadpan delivery, reinforced the connection between hotel bookings and Hotels.com in the minds of the target audience, resulting in a 30% increase in site traffic.

  • Select an Image from the Gallery

  • Incorporating humor into your marketing efforts can also be as simple as adding a funny element to social media content, blog posts, or other mediums. Establish a vivid scene and character, and maintain the internal logic of the story by following the rules of the game.

    It's important to keep in mind that humor is all about context, and you should make sure that the jokes you use are timely and relatable to your target audience, as well as appropriate for the medium you're using.

  • Use Humour to Connect with Your Audience

  • One example of this is Hotels.com's use of Captain Obvious in its ad campaign.

  • Mistakes are Almost Unavoidable in Business

  • Imagine there’s an online store called Grow Feeds that sells feeds to farmers who rear fish and chickens. 

    Thanks to positive reviews from their customers, business is booming, and the Grow Feeds team is working overtime as new sales continue to pour in. Everything’s going great.
  • Now imagine Grow Feeds fills hundreds of fish feed orders with bags of chicken feeds. Whoops! Unhappy customers start barking about the mix-up on social media. How should they respond?

    a.  Blame the shipping company.
    b. Take responsibility and clearly explain what happened.
    c. Say nothing and move forward with business.

  • Select an Image from the Gallery

  • It would be best for Grow Feeds to acknowledge its mistake, take responsibility, and explain the failure. 

    Making excuses or ignoring the complaints will only expound the backlash.

  • Lesson Summary

  • In this module, you have learned that:
    • The "audience first" approach to product creation involves engaging with a target audience through content marketing and building an online community.
    • Researching and understanding your target audience helps create products that meet their needs and desires. When you know your target audience, you can use content marketing to build an online community and gather insights to inform your product development.
    • Customer Lifetime Value = (Average Annual Transactions Per Customer) x (Average Profit Per Transaction) x (Average Number of Years Customers Remain).
    • You can use the insights from the calculation of your CLV to make strategic decisions about how to allocate the marketing budget and target efforts toward the most valuable segments of your customer base.

  • Lesson Summary

  • In this module, you have learned that:
    • The "audience first" approach to product creation involves engaging with a target audience through content marketing and building an online community.
    • Researching and understanding your target audience helps create products that meet their needs and desires. When you know your target audience, you can use content marketing to build an online community and gather insights to inform your product development.
    • Customer Lifetime Value = (Average Annual Transactions Per Customer) x (Average Profit Per Transaction) x (Average Number of Years Customers Remain).
    • You can use the insights from the calculation of your CLV to make strategic decisions about how to allocate the marketing budget and target efforts toward the most valuable segments of your customer base.
